Reviews.Title: “Indulgent and luxurious surroundings, only surpassed by the genuine, customized service.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week. Luxurious accomodations that could not have been better. Service was the best we have ever experienced at a hotel. Staff genuinely care that you have a wonderful experience at the hotel and in the city of Boston. For a memorable and special experience, book The Four Seasons Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Seasons Boston in the past and have always been happy but it has been more than four years since my last stay. The service from the front desk people, to room service staff to restaurant staff was exceptional. The staff was actually able to anticipate our needs which with a good Four Seasons team is what they pride themselves doing. The hotel is very comfortable and current and delivers what is excepted of a top tier hotel without being stuffy, another Four Seasons trademark. I would recommend this property to anyone who's does not mind paying a little extra for a luxury property with great service and outstanding location within Boston.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best anywhere”
Reviews.Author: thunderbird0609
Reviews.Content: Whenever I can get any kind of "reasonable" rate for the Four Seasons Bostons, I feel like a lottery winner. Simply the best hotel in Boston, best location, best amenities and best service. Complimentary health Club that is beautiful with all amenities, unbelievable staff, and concierge desk that will do anything for you and send you to the best restaurants you never thought of. When the local channels on the TV were on the fritz, I casually mentioned it the nextt morning. They replaced the TV and that evening the manager sent a wonderful Pinot Noir for my inconvenience! Are you kidding me? This may be the best staff of any 4 seasons to which I've been, and makes the Ritz across the Public Garden seem like a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mariaf96
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at this hotel, and it has been consistently excellent. The staff is always helpful and courteous. They called my husband and I, and the kids by name upon our arrival, which really made us feel special. The room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. Our toothapaste was confiscated by airport security--when I requested some at the hotel, we got toothbrushes, toothpaste and mouthwash! The 8th floor pool is beautiful and peaceful, and the work out area is well-equipped. The food was great, althoug pricey. Overall, a very memorable and relaxing stay--expensive, but worh it!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kalil1957
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel, well located, excellent service, great restaurant and spa

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Alain and Dania G
Reviews.Content: Very professional and friendly staff, fancy rooms, and excellent service. Room service was delicious. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Boston”
Reviews.Author: Saskatoonbanker
Reviews.Content: As always, the Four Seasons label has provided first class service and amenities that always meet and/or exceed our expections. World Class, First Class, A+++++ (yes, that`s 5 of them) They had the "Best" Four Seaons staff so far!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: thebrown-eyedgirl
Reviews.Content: Best in Boston....no need to look anywhere else for a hotel. The security of staying w/ FS is worth every penny. Have never had an issue that couldn't be resolved. Fabulous staff...always friendly and recognize myself and my husband when we come to stay. Truly a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Excels in every area”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovingProf
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days at the Boston 4S. Service, food (both restaurant and room service), decor, ambiance all superlative. Our room was beautifully appointed. Just a great experience. (Quick info note: the spa only offers massages, no other services).

Reviews.Title: “Great location; it could do with some updating”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro D
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location for business travellers. However, it feels a bit outdated, particularly against more recent hotel additions in the city.

Reviews.Title: “You can go home again”
Reviews.Author: nstearns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made one of our return visits to Boston after living away for many years. We had always enjoyed dinners, brunches, etc at the Four Seasons and occasionally spent a night or two. We've stayed at other Boston hotels (Taj, Mandarin Oriental, XI Beacon) but will return to the Four Seasons again. The location, the service and the rooms are all first class and there is something about the hotel that is at once elegant and comfortable. If you can snag a room with a view of the Boston Garden (we did), that is a plus. We were sad to see that the fine dining restaurant had closed but were not disappointed by our dinner and high tea in the Bristol Lounge. This is truly a Boston classic in the best sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: QDawg579
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the weekend for my birthday. Everything was outstanding - food, service, and view from the 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, top shelf rooms & amenities and stand out service made our first trip to Boston a very memorable one.”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Tremendous service. Luxurious and spacious rooms. Beacon Hill location close to amazing Newbury St shopping, the park etc. Very strong restaurant/bar/lounge offering... that's very popular with the locals. Fun "Sundaes on Saturdays" ice cream buffet until midnight. Take advantage of the amenities... esp the steam room.

Reviews.Title: “a very special place”
Reviews.Author: bab6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a quick getaway weekend to Boston, and our favorite part was the Four Seasons. On arrival a friendly valet jumped right out to greet us; it was Superbowl weekend and he was wearing a Patriots jersey over his uniform, so right off we knew there would be an element of playfulness to the elegant hotel. We had a very friendly and welcoming reception by Katherine at the front desk; she was helpful throughout our stay, suggesting restaurants and activities and always remembering us by name. The concierge, Walter, did a marvelous job helping us select restaurants. He was like a walking restaurant guide and knew the ins and outs of the menus, views, and ambience. And he graciously made all our reservations and sent a note to our room with with confirmations and directions on how to find them. The room itself was lovely and beautifully appointed. As we had made reservations using AmEx's fine hotels and resort's service, we were upgraded from a basic room to a top floor room with breathtaking views of the Boston Commons below. Wow. Also on the top floor is a terrific, light filled pool and gym with state of the art machines, including an amazing stationary bike with a monitor that allows you to "virtually" race through various mountains, very fun and great workout. Before dinner we had drinks at the hotel's Bristol Lounge, which was abuzz with beautiful people. And Sunday morning we had a great buffet brunch there, too. They had a wonderful selections of salads, omelets, fruits, an interesting variation on eggs benedict, and my favorite - oatmeal with a sweet brulee crust and a fruit compote base in an individual cast iron dish. All with a view of the park across the street. It was a great stay, actually, more of an experience than simply a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised about other reviews”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at multiple Four Seasons properties. Our conclusion is that Four Seasons should be embarassed to put their name on this one. Yes, the service is outstanding and meets or exceeds Four Seasons standards. But the property itself is aging and the signs are visible everywhere and most visible in the common areas as well as in the bathrooms. We had just recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Boston, which is in the same price range. It was clear to us that we were taking several steps down in modernity the first few minutes we were in Four Seasons. And one major unforgivable complaint...every morning from 7:30-8:00 during our three day stay there was insufficient hot water. Nothing like a lukewarm/cool shower to start a day!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaGarnet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a long-awaited getaway to Boston and spent the weekend enjoying being pampered and totally relaxing at the Four Seasons Hotel. Everyone there was so friendly, smiling and helpful, the room was comfortable and very pretty, the food in the restaurant was to die for, and the view from the pool room on the 8th floor while sipping coffee and watching dawn break over the city was unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. It is worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Higbie
Reviews.Content: Perfect room. Perfect service. Perfect location. Perfect food. Love this place. (And the gym is also fabulous!)

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Henry G
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a stay in Boston, the Four Seasons is the place to stay. We have stayed here in several times and never disappointed. Service, location and staff are just great. We will be back in March.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent experience”
Reviews.Author: RRM1020
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons are an exemplary run business when it comes to service and attention detail. The hard part is maintaining the consistency. They do it. The spa/gym area is nice along side the door pool. Location is great with many stores and restaurants within walking distance. Great staff. The food was fantastic as I attending a dinner for an event hosted by the hotel (the best hotel food I have had). Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Abhorrent service”
Reviews.Author: DD196960713
Reviews.Content: I had a ridiculous experience at the Four Seasons Boston during my last stay. The service was abhorrent and I will never stay here again for that reason. The hotel was notified ahead of time of my arrival time, but yet when I arrived, it took quite a while to check in as the front desk person stalled and delayed and went in the back twice before assigning me a room. I awoke quite early to catch a flight and I find at 5:30am that the shower does not work. I had to leave and thus had no time to call for repairs. The explanation I received for the delay in checking in was that there was a "large international delegation" that departed later than expected. Check out time is noon approximately, and I checked in after 6:00pm. It is not acceptable to wait 20 minutes to be checked into a five star hotel, nor to be unable to use the most basic of facilities. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MV1
Reviews.Content: This is currently the ONLY five star hotel in Boston...and it certainly lives up to that. Staff is superb, pleasant and caring. Made me feel like royalty...I only live 30 minutes from the hotel and had the chance to spend the weekend. Had an in room massage. I have had better massages, at least I tried it. Wasn't awful, but not terrific. Breakfast was GREAT both days. I did lunch and dinner outside of hotel. GREAT nights sleep, GREAT atmosphere in the lounge. Great location to walk around the city. I can not wait to go back!! Next time I will take my two children. They are also very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Doux
Reviews.Content: From the luxurious accomodations to the extraordinary staff who are genuine in making you feel welcome, the Four Seasons is the best hotel choice for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Shanu400001
Reviews.Content: Best part is the location: diagonally across the Boston Commons and stone's throw from Newbury Street. Second best part: The service, as I have seen with other Four Seasons hotels worldwide, probably better! Compared to my not-so-great experiences with other hotel chains in New York/ LA etc, this experience thanks to the staff being so hospitable and caring, left me thinking why it is so difficult to find such wonderful hospitality elsewhere in the States! Rooms are spacious and comfortable with clean bathrooms. Could be better but I'd be willing to overlook that given that the above two positives more than compensate for that. I'd definitely stay here again whenever I am back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Dated”
Reviews.Author: JWinNYC
Reviews.Content: Time for a facelift. The rooms are dark, tired and dated...carpeting is worn, bathrooms are blah and the public areas look like they did when the place opened. Spa is currently under construction and hopefully the gym is on the list for a re-do as well. In it's favor, Boston doesn't have much in the way of luxury hotels (sans the new Mandarin), so it continues to fill up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: I would never stay anywhere else! This hotel is amazing!!! It's better than perfect!

Reviews.Title: “My Family spend Christmas at the Four Seasons and we all Loved it because we were well taken care of.”
Reviews.Author: Tyler M
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to all types of travelers. What I liked the best is how welcoming they were to my whole family including my dogs. They were well prepared to handle anything. My whole family teenagers and adults alike felt relaxed and cared for! We went for Christmas and all had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - shame about the pool area otherwise would be 5*”
Reviews.Author: HM1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel (and in particular our room) was marvellous. Worth booking one of the larger rooms - it was spacious and well-furnished. We travelled out for 5 nights for my boyfriend's birthday. It was worth telling the hotel in advance because they put some cakes and other bits and pieces in the room for our arrival. A shame that, as with many city hotels, the pool area was a little sub-par. Nothing wrong in particular, could have been better appointed. Probably needs a refurbish. But only a small complaint (and it was very clean which is the main thing). The staff were charming (and the concierge especially helpful). As with a number of nice city hotels, they have a free car service if you're only travelling a mile or two away. Nice but you have to book well in advance (as in before you arrive, ideally, if you happen to have made some reservations out of the hotel in advance). Nice breakfast buffet. Also, the main restaurant does a wonderful cold seafood platter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location across from the public garden/common and wonderful FS service”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: Loved the service here and the rooms are lovely. We had a room facing the public garden which was lovely (trees all lit up for the holidays). Ordered room service breakfast and it come very quickly - always nice. no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, ok amenities”
Reviews.Author: shivaswrath
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Boston and had a good stay at the Four Seasons. They are known for their premier customer service, and they certainly delivered! The location is great, near good food, and you can walk virtually everywhere. They have a good gym, nice pool, and available hot tub for guests. Attentive gym attendant gave me a towel mid-workout, good touch! Con's are pretty straightforward: the hotel is showing it's age, and probably needs room renovations. They aren't bad, but you can tell it hasn't been given a fresh redo in awhile. Their restaurant is under renovation on the first floor, so keep that in mind. Room service is horribly expensive - but the mild mannered and highly attentive servers offset this. I paid $60 for a grilled cheese sandwich, drink, fires, and salad, WOAH! All in all, one of the better hotels to stay in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “I want to give it five stars.”
Reviews.Author: catelisa48
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is exceptional (and worthy of a five star rating.) Almost every staff member was pleasant and very helpful, the location is great, and the public areas are worthy of the five star rating, as well. The reason I can't give the hotel a five star rating overall is the rooms are just a little bit tired and in need of a refresh (the carpet was on the dingy side- not Bates motel dingy- but for a luxury hotel, it had seen better days.) There was also one server at the restaurant who was not as pleasant as others- we referred to him as "Mr. Cranky Pants." I hope he was just having an off-night, because every other employee was amiable and helpful. Also, one note (and this is a personal preference FYI, not a complaint): The beds are FIRM. My traveling companion loved it, but instead I chose the (surprisingly comfortable) roll-away in our suite instead.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Bill Taylor and his well trained staff are simply " The Best " What a Fantastic Hotel to visit, keep up the GREAT work and Outstanding Hospitality .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: parcapecod
Reviews.Content: Just love the place. Many long term employees who always go above and beyond to make your stay great Had room service breakfast and it was brought quickly and the food was very good. The lobby or the Bristol Lounge are fun places to people watch. Saw Boston Celtic's captain Paul Pierce on this visit Four Seasons does set the standart for service for all hotels Wish I could move in

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding -- As expected”
Reviews.Author: rbdiaz
Reviews.Content: A great afternoon / evening at the Four Seasons, Boston,. Although I have stayed at other FS's, this was the first time in Boston. The property is in a great location, very comfortable, and great service. A great place for a getaway - but expensive. For some reason, our dinner service was not great -- but I think this is an anomoly.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Treat : Indulgence & Luxury”
Reviews.Author: KimandFamily
Reviews.Content: We had an unusual chance to indulge in the luxury offered by the 4 Seasons and it was a wonderful pre-holiday treat. The details really matter - a courtesy car got us to the Aquarium lickety-split while the concierge was able to find a restaurant within walking distance that worked well for both grandmother and grandchildren. The pool was lovely (although small for lap swimming) and the morning espresso/mini-muffins in the lobby was huge for giving me a way to let my family sleep in. The staff was friendly and helpful and although it was luxurious it did not feel precious - I didn't feel like my kids were out of place. Room service was fast and yummy. We couldn't afford to travel at this level all the time, but I was surprised at how much the extra luxury mattered, esp. during this harried holiday time and in an inter-generational situation where we spent quite a bit of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go ahead and bring the kids!”
Reviews.Author: Doug F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time with our two girls at a hotel that manages to bring the best of an "old school" feel (big room and great service) without being dated. The staff is on top of their game with professionalism and warmth. And the location .. you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: All of the staff we met were focused on giving exceptional customer service. The location is wonderful-we were able to walk to shopping, and a show at the Wang Theatre (Citi Center), The room was perfect. I will return, and can heartily recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ... as expected!”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was as good as you would expect with the name and reputation that proceeds it ... fantastic! We have stayed at many hotels in the Boston area for various reasons and this was by far one of the best in all areas. The room itself was very spacious, the bed was comfortable, the room service was fast and delicious, the staff in the restaurant and bar were friendly, ... I could go on and on... definitely a great value (somewhat expensive but worth it to me)!

Reviews.Title: “A place for Royals”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld100
Reviews.Content: It was most impressive. Remember to ask for whatever and whenever you want. When booking a room ask about the "Mrs. Hansen Suite." You may have to speak to a manager to get information and the price. Just do it you'll have a great time. P.S. Don't forget to bring your bathing suit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service as usual”
Reviews.Author: hojokap12
Reviews.Content: Front desk acknowleged me as a returning guest. Housekeeper left me a bookmarker for my library book. Morning expresso good as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: citychic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful - enjoyed the warmly decorated rooms, bathrooms, and conference facilities. We booked this hotel for a large conference and were not disappointed. The food was a standout as well (lobster rolls!). Lovely service from start to finish. The location is also great - a short walk from Newbury Street and Copley Place.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, super service”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: Perfect respite from the metropolis. Four Seasons perfection throughout. Couldn't ask for a better locale, across from the park and historical walk. Loved the concierge, helpful and expert recommendations. Rooms are a bit dated but spotlessly clean and functional. Fantastic service and food at the restaurant and room service. Forgot numerous toiletries, phoned for help with these items and they delivered all to our room post haste. Will return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent our 12th wedding anniversary at the Four Seasons in Boston. The staff made our weekend very memorable. They gave us many upgrades and special surprises during our stay. I have NEVER had a better experience with a hotel stay! The staff were always happy, cheerful and very helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and the food was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: dsw_no1
Reviews.Content: wonderful relaxing stay at this Four Seasons, my wife and I felt really welcome and at home there. the staff throughout the hotel could not have been friendlier or more helpful, and the concierge service in particular was wonderful - they cheerfully organised theatre tickets and transportation, and helped with restaurant choice. the evening bar area was lively with a good atmosphere, and we enjoyed the food there too.

Reviews.Title: “First Boston visit”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: Knowledgable staff, excellent service, great location. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location. Very attentive staff, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Wandering-from-CT
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff, great rooms. Room service was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Boston!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kari003
Reviews.Content: The best and most beautiful hotel in boston! Perfect, elegant hotel, very nice spa area and a wonderful panoramic ... the best and most beautiful place to celebrate weddings Will definitely come back - I love Boston and the Four Season Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just as great as remembered!!”
Reviews.Author: jmc007
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this great Hotel. First visit was over 7 years ago!! My daughter and son were with me for a college visit and everything about the hotel was great from the reception staff that greeted us at our very late arrival to the concierge assisting with dinner reservations and use of the Town Car. The room had been updated and was at the level one expects at the Four Seasons. The fitness facility was busy, but had plenty of machines and equipemnt to accomodate all. The setting overlooking the indoor pool and park is great. My only complaint was that I hadn't booked through my Amex Platinum travel and had requested a late checkout. I was provided one, but charged half day rate. I think Four Seasons needs to follow suit with Penninsula that gladly extends early and late checkouts to guests without charge.

Reviews.Title: “The For Seasons is top of the line.”
Reviews.Author: fritstel
Reviews.Content: Overall, the nicest hotel I ever stayed at. When I arrived it was raining however the hotel was warm and cozy inside. All the employees were friendly and accomodating. I used the spa one day and the female attendant eas most helpful. When I asked for a robe she was right there to provide me with one and also a pair of slippers. I have no complaints with your hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly attentive staff in a luxurious setting.”
Reviews.Author: knaberlin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are plush and comfortable -- plenty of workspace for getting things done. The pool/spa facilities upstairs are top notch -- and offer a beautiful view of the Boston skyline from the swimming pool. The staff is absolutely outstanding -- helpful, attentive and extremely professional. For all the attention to detail and great service, it's cheesy to charge extra for using WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons Boston is the best hotel experience I've ever had, in any city, in any country. Really.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: I've never written a TripAdvisor review, but then I wasn't expecting the Four Seasons Boston to be the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The location, the service, the food, the pool area on the roof--I loved it all. I only wish I could've stayed longer. I would have eaten more french fries. They were sublime, and I don't particularly like french fries.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston”
Reviews.Author: AnnWebsterGrovesMO
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute! Beautiful hotel, gorgeous scenery with the Garden just outside the front door, minutes from fabulous Newbury Street and Beacon HIll. Felt like a princess the entire 6 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: ivster
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Sept with our todler son. Of all the hotels we have stayed with him the Four Seasons went beyond any other hotel in looking after him. Usually we just get a pack and play at most hotels and an extra towel. The Four Seasons a real crib some great bedding his own kid friendly shampoos and a copy of Make way for the Ducklings to keep. The staff were amazing and the Hotel itself is classic elegance. Great central location. Well be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Lovely weekend at the Four Seasons. Special requests not honored, however.”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This property has one of the best locations in Boston, IMPECCABLE service (above and beyond) and lovely rooms and lobby area. We were especially impressed with the overt friendliness of the staff ( hard to find anywhere these days). Our only complaint about our room- which was extremely clean and in great condition was that for the super expensive price we paid, we had a super ugly view of the roof and a parking garage. I had requested the nicest view possible but ended up with what has to be one of the worst in the hotel. I did not feel that the hotel was full and so this was disappointing since I did make a special request. The room on the 5th floor was also louder than I would have liked. We were woken up several times during the night by street noise and other patrons in the hallways. I had asked for a quiet room with a view with extra pillows as my special request. the pillows were not there either, which leads me to believe that no one actually checks the reservation special requests online. Otherwise a lovely place and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bristol lounge .. Doomed.. What happened towhat used to the upscale food and service”
Reviews.Author: Miamidisaster
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review out of my concern about a place used to be the epitome of class and perfection. I was so disappointed with my recent experience and kind of embarrassed. I had out of town friends visiting and after a long shopping day, I wanted to treat them for a nice dinner and drink at what I expected ( and used to at Tahoe place) to be an upscale quality food and service. The bad signs started when the waiter brought the bottle of water and glasses. Tried to take a sip and was so upset by the fishy small of the glasses. We usher to a waiter and asked to change the glasses, another waiter who noticed our reaction came to our table and he had a running nose ( must be cold) and looked very sloppy and replaced the glasses. The food came and as a big disappointment, the soup, then the salad, the press presentation and taste were more of a cheap fast food or chain restaurant quality wise. Even the tea and the way it was served was so unlike what I am used to get at this same Four Seasons. All in all, very disappointing and sad to see how bas this place has gone.. I hope the management takes notes and try to salvage this place before it is too late,.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door we were treated better than I have been at any other hotel!! We were walked over to the elevator, handed our key all the while the staff was running around because there was a wedding in the hotel that night. Felt pretty good that they went the extra step. beds were comfy, didn't like the pillows though, too soft!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug01945
Reviews.Content: I live 40 minutes north of Boston, but stay in the city at least once per week. I like to mix it up and have tried all of the luxury hotels: Mandarin Oriental, Taj, Ritz, Nine Zero, Liberty, Boston Harbor, Intercontinental, etc, but the Four Seasons is the best. The doormen always recognize me by name when I arrive as well as the front desk associates and concierge. The rooms are classically decorated and impeccably clean. A swim in the pool overlooking the the Public Garden and Beacon Hill with floor to ceiling windows is a fantastic way to begin the dayâ€”after waffles in bed of course. The Bristol Lounge is one of my favorite places to entertain clients and friends. The bar staff is friendly and the food is fantastic. The hotel is centrally located with numerous restaurants and high end stores as well as the Prudential Mall within walking distance. You simply can't go wrong with the Four Seasons Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in town!”
Reviews.Author: ACB40_11
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault our stay at the Four Seasons - made very welcome by all staff from the front desk to the pool staff. Lucky enough to stay in an Exec Suite ( had 2 kids) and they put the sofa bed and roll away down each night to accommodate. Room service was excellent on few occasions we used it for Hot Choc & Cookies! Spa/Pool was spotless and facilities second to none. Concierge and parking staff were so friendly and cheerful - even in the chilly mornings. Four Seasons hotel staff made our trip to Boston a fantastic one at every level - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as always”
Reviews.Author: EricandBettina
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Four Seasons in Boston on multiple occasions and it is always, always amazing. We travel with our 3 year old, so things can be a bit hectic, but the staff handles everything with grace, charm and genuine interest and care. Nothing is too much and nothing goes unnoticed. The rooms are spacious and well laid out, the Bristol Lounge is a must for all meal periods. Thank you FSBoston for being our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Easy,comfortable,and interesting”
Reviews.Author: Melvin F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is truly a great hotel.It is located opposite a beautiful park and convenient to the airport ,lovely restaurants and many sightseeing places for tourists. The hotel itself is very well kept and the public rooms are beautful. Staff are of the highest quality,well trained and supervised. It was a very nice experience.and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, hotel revamp made it much more contemporary. Great fitness center and room service.”
Reviews.Author: lpnyccal
Reviews.Content: The italian restaurant Via Mazza around the corner is very good and Exhale Spa (next door) is great for yoga and core classes.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTraveler13
Reviews.Content: Everything was spectacular. I travel a great deal and this was the best service I've ever encountered. The staff were friendly, but the biggest thing was the attention to detail of the people who cleaned my room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great personal service, but charge for wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: rac-columbus
Reviews.Content: Here for a business meeting. Checkin, bag handling, room all very nice. Beautiful room. But...and a big but, there was no high speed Internet access in the room, and there was a charge for wi-fi! I was completely dumbfounded and asked just to be sure. Despite the great location, customer service, and impeccably clean room, I would go somewhere else if this was on my dollar...it was not. It is amazing to me that a hotel of this high level would be this backward.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Talisker55
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a luxury hotel in downtown Boston, this is it. Impeccable service, fantastic food and within walking distance of most of the sites you will want to see. You have to visit Legal Seafoods restaurant, right behind the hotel. Boston Common is directly across the street and Beacon Hill, Lousiburg Square, Acorn Street, "Cheers" bar. The staff was excellent in helping us get to Fenway Pary, Harvard and MIT, even arranging for a car to be brought to the hotel so we could visit Salem. If you're looking for Wal-Mart pricing this isn't the place. But if you want top notch service and a vacation to remember, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mmm0692
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of luxury places in Boston, but I always seem to end up going back to the Four Seasons. Tops in service, location,atmosphere, comfort, and amenities. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice people. Posh, befitting a Four Seasons.”
Reviews.Author: Geotrash
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice people. Posh, befitting a Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nick N
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful night stay in a "moderate room" that was actually quite nice...not sure if they upgraded us, but the room was far nicer than expected. The hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel like we were the only ones staying there. The concierge (David) really helped us find some fun things to do when our original plans didn't work out. The nice added touches by the staff, like champagne and chocolates in the room during the afternoon, the turndown service, and even the towel and cold water waiting for me at the entrance after a morning run are what set this hotel apart from the other luxury hotels in the area. It is expensive, but the added touches make you feel like the splurge was actually worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Price is what you pay, value is what you receive”
Reviews.Author: TheOaksCostaRica
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Standard in LA, we stayed at The Four Seasons for two nights before going to the White Mountains to see the fall foliage. Wish we had stayed longer. We loved the wash paint in the bath. The level of luxury throughout displays the Four Seasons' expected attention to detail. Here, you do get what you pay for...excellence. Location..could it be better, fronting the public gardens? Quality of rooms and common areas. Excellent. Even though you are paying three or four times the Standard's rates, you are getting value for money. On arriving, Rox said it reminded her of the Carlton. That it does, without the French attitude. The test of a review is, would you come back? The Four Seasons Boston? Duh.

Reviews.Title: “excellent room”
Reviews.Author: giselledbueno
Reviews.Content: This is a 5* HOTEL that make you feel very good and comfortable. The room is excellent . The location is perfect and the whole staff very kind and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Randy S
Reviews.Content: I'm not a "world traveler", but definitely the best service that I've had at any hotel. The hotel itself is very nice, clean and is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Costello3
Reviews.Content: The Boston Four Seasons is one of my favorite hotels. The location is perfect, the staff is very pleasant, and the rooms are terrific. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel in the North East and my favorite in the US.”
Reviews.Author: JRGNY
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, this is my fourth stay and the hotel remains impeccable from the moment you arrive in the driveway to the moment you leave. I have been both with and without my family. Four business it is perfect with all the comforts. For the family it's amazing. They have a little red wagon behind the front desk full of stuffed animals so each toddler chooses their own. This os accompanied by little four seasons robes and matching slippers waiting in the room. The bedrooms are very large and comfortable with the typical Four Seasons elegance, great flat screen tv with plenty of channels. I recommend the view to the park although I didn't have one from my room, but it is stil pleasant and quiet. The bathrooms are good size and they have nice amenities and great towels They have a great gym and pool. The common rooms are very elegant yet comfortable. The service is superb, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: SheilaWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Four Seasons Hotels I especially chose to stay here in Boston. I was not disappointed. The hotel is very modern, yet outrageously opulent. Marble floors and high ceilings in the foyer set the seal for a wonderfully luxurious stay. The health / spa / swimming pool is on the roof top, though enclosed by a beautiful grass roof.There are many spa treatments on offer, though a bit pricey. Though we had a standard room it was beautiful; spacious, beautifully appointed, with L'Occitaine products in the bathroom, ( regularly topped up and replaced ). Every member of staff, even the domestic staff, was charming and went out of their way to help. "If your preferred meal isn't on the menu, 'just give us a little time and we will make it for you'." This extended to Boston cream pie and grilled lobster, as well as personalised breakfasts. Expensive? yes but worth every penny. The hotel is in a great situation within easy walking distance of all the parts of Boston you would want to see. It is easy to find and sits comfortably on the side of Boston Common, (Boston's "Central Park'')on the opposite side to Old Boston and the Cheers bar. The hop-on hop-off tour bus stops just outside, so there is no need for a car or taxis. Having said that Boston is a very easy city to drive around. If you are flying to Boston Airport it is only 15 minutes by car from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended in Spite of Aging Physical Structure”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveller
Reviews.Content: In booking into a top luxury hotel in a major US city today with a nightly price of $900, one expects a number of things: two sinks in the bathroom, a separate shower and generous size bathtub, a spa of some sorts, excellent food and service. My experience this past week allows me to vouch for the wonderful service and food at this 4 Seasons property. However, I was surprised to find that the physical structure of the hotel rooms don't seem to have been upgraded since I first stayed there 20 years ago. I heard that they had invested $40million in room renovations. However, the new soft goods (carpet, drapes,etc.) must have been really expensive since the same shower/tub (small) combination and single sink in the bathroom had not been updated. When I showed up for the massage I booked there were two fans in the room to cool down the heat generated by the adjacent mens locker room facilities. While the massage itself was very good, I felt like I had stumbled into someone's spare room off the kitchen for my treatment. Clearly the massage experience is an afterthought at this hotel. However, the indoor pool is still in wonderful shape and a pleasure to use. The physical structure aside, the service at this property is absolutely first rate. By the time I called for a room service breakfast the second day, the woman on the phone remembered what I had ordered the day before! Everyone on staff is incredibly nice and helpful However, when the starting rate of a hotel is $900 a night, the friendliness of the staff should not be expected to gloss over an outdated physical structure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March on business as well, and was really impressed with the hotel - the slightly more modern decor really worked with the high level of service most of us expect from Four Seasons. It had snowed the day before I came in and I had a beautiful view of the park covered in white - I actually stopped and took it in, which I rarely do while in a city hotel. I loved the location of the hotel and the burger was amazing!! :)

Reviews.Title: “great pleasure to stay in”
Reviews.Author: reddprdon
Reviews.Content: Everything is spot-on with this hotel - impeccably clean, great sized rooms, comfy beds, fantastic service and friendly staff. I stayed in a classic room for a weekend in the city and it had everything I needed for a comfortable stay. Plus, there are loads of great finishing touches which really add to overall experience: from the free fruit and refreshments in the lobby to the great range of toiletries in the bathroom. Overall, The 4S feels truly charming and welcoming; a real pleasure to come back to each night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bex W
Reviews.Content: The spa at this four seasons is incredible and the staff were very friendly. Only down point was the size of the bath tub - considering the bed is absolutely huge the bath tub was not very roomy in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service”
Reviews.Author: Okapi
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Boston this was a great selection. The service at the hotel was excellent from the doormen to the front desk to the concierge and the restaurant staff. They were calling us by name by the first evening. Everyone was very professional and welcoming. The location across from the Public Garden was lovely. The hotel is just steps away from all the prime shopping in Boston. After exploring Boston and seeing other parts of the city that were a little "grittier", I was happy to be at the FS. The room is very nice although not overly large, it was more than adequate. Make sure you leave your room available for turndown which supplies water, laundry and shoe shine items, and ice replenishment. A truly memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best location but too kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: novapanda
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing. Best concierge service we have ever experienced. Ask for Jason. His restaurant and sightseeing arrangements were excellent. The one downside is that the Four Seasons caters to families, so service for adults has suffered. Expect kids running all over at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing tops the Four Seasons! Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: jhagstrom
Reviews.Content: We were looking at colleges with our son -- we could not have been treated more beautifully - it is "exceptional" on steroids! My son wanted nachos - which were not on the menu -- so we decided to go out and eat on Newbury St. We arrived back with a custom 'nacho feast' -- complimentary! Over and above describes the Four Seasons! We stayed in Denver too -- amazing! Can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this”
Reviews.Author: ThirdWrangler
Reviews.Content: Top notch from start to finish. We stayed with our two daughters who were greeted with a soft toy and cookies. The Bristol Lounge has a great, interesting kids menu. We all enjoyed the pool (where else can you swim overlooking the public garden?) And our rooms were magnificent. Yes, it's not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Service of the staff is impeccable, from the room service to the front desk. Simply a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: callstuz
Reviews.Content: Whenever one stays at a Four Seasons, the expectations are generally very high. The Four Seasons in Boston did not disappoint. The rooms were typical of what you'd expect at a Four Seasons...simply elegant. Not overdone, clean, and very comfortable. But beyond the room, the Four Seasons is second to none in terms of service. We had several college visits (after all, it is Boston), and at check in, we spoke to the woman behind the counter. She had graduated from one of Boston's fine colleges, and she offered us great advice. Even answered questions topics for an essay. We also took advantage of the concierge, who booked us reservations at a very popular restaurant on Newberry Street. We had a prime outside location with no wait, and there was a line. Finally, the location. Directly across the street from Boston Common. One block away from the Arlington T-Stop, so you can go anywhere. And high-end shopping right outside the door. Valet parking is on the premisis. $48 a night, but it's Boston. Car was always there within 5-10 minutes, if not sooner. Finally, my kids are older, but we passed a rolling ice cream cart that visited a room with toddlers. He was making them sundaes with all of the fixins. You should have seen their faces...they will never forget. Two thumbs up at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service-Beginning to End”
Reviews.Author: Mom92647
Reviews.Content: I was staying for a convetion being held in Boston and was probably one of the further hotels compared to most of the attendees ...but it was worth it. The service at this hotel is impeccable. Everyone my family came in contact with at this hotel was sincere and striving to be helpful. I would especially like to applaud the front desk staff. Between the number of times I lost my key, to trying to decide at the hotel for another night and miss my flight due to an illness, they were very patient and helpful. Room service even offered complimentay cookies to my meal when I told them I was under the weather. The thing I will most remember (but I'm sorry I can't remember his name!) but a gentleman from the front desk waited with me outside for about 5-10 minutes in the morning at about 5 am on August 24 while the valet was bringing my car around and it was vacant outside. I travel frequently on business and I guarantee that no one from any other hotel staff has done that before! Four Seasons, please acknowledge that staff member. I'm sorry I can't remember his name! it's the little things like that set the Four Seasons, but particularly the Four Seasons Boston in this circumstance apart fromthe rest. The General Manager has done well to instill in his/her staff a sense of always striving for excellence in their service, and it shows! Thank you for makin my stay, and my family's, so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: sequinedshoes
Reviews.Content: As anyone who has stayed at a Four Seasons before will know they are generally amongst the best hotels in any given city/location. The Four Seasons Boston is no exception. The staff were friendly and courteous. Nothing was too much trouble. My suite was spacious and well furnished. I also loved that they picked up on my arrival via Twitter and welcomed me electronically as well. It's a little thing - but as with most thing it's the details that count. An excellent hotel. The GM and his staff can be proud. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfy hotel I've had in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Pabs_HK
Reviews.Content: Quiet, relaxing and conveniently located. Would be nice to have breakfast before 7am but the coffee and bagel counter by the lobby will do

Reviews.Title: “Fully met expectations with courteous and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hank073
Reviews.Content: What more can one say? It was a positive experience with no negatives in terms of the hotel itself, the room or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless!!!”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Boston 9 times over the past few years.....it's such a fantastic city hotel, surely the best hotel in Boston, & one of my favorite hotels in the US. :) The staff, from the Front Desk, the the Bristol, to Room service are all so amazing, kind, warm & utterly professional & polite. I recently stayed a few days ago & all was perfect, as always! I was in room 522 & this particular room felt quite spacious, but all of the rooms I've had are a nice size. I don't think I've ever had to wait for a room either, which is so nice when traveling! The rooms are quiet & have so many nice touches, including a Sachet in the closet, a jogging map of the area, a selection of current magazines, a small flower in the bathroom & plant in the room, etc. The beds are amazing, with great pillows!! The food at the hotel is really good!!! The Bristol Lounge is the main dining area & the service is incredible! Their Lobster roll, Crab Chowder, Steak, desserts, are all amazing & so tasty!!! The fitness center has a lovely set-up with chilled mint-scented towels, fruit flavored water, fresh fruit.....nice touch!! This is the only hotel I will stay at when visiting Boston & I truly look forward to my stays here! they are always very memorable, flawless & relaxing:) looking forward to returning in November for a long weekend! Thanks for everything FS Boston! Best, Patrick Winkler NYC --

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable customer service”
Reviews.Author: lafou
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Four Seasons in Boston is always efficient and professional. The food is great, the rooms are spotless, the spa/gym is on the top floor with windows overlooking the Boston Common. I've been here about six times & have nothing but good things to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Consistently Superb Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Boston lives up to its reputation as a luxury hotel of the first order. Our rooms, food, drinks and wine, over many years have never let us down. The Bristol Lounge is famous for its hospitality, food and wine well beyond Boston. The staff throughout the hotel is of the highest level, always courteous, efficient, and willing to go to any length to meet their guests' needs. Bottom line, the hotel is perfect and a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: shildon
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a lovely location, and it is worth paying for a Garden view room. We particularly appreciated the fitness room / pool overlooking the Garden where coffee, fresh fruit and newspapers were available every morning, and water flavored with fresh fruit and/or green vegetables was available all day. Also, fresh apples are available everywhere at all times of the day. We were very grateful for the excellent breakfast we were served in the Bristol Lounge even though it was lunch-time. Finally, when we did have a problem, it was addressed in a more than satisfactory manner. This is a tranquil oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ColdFrontChuck
Reviews.Content: Check in and Check out was very fast and convenient. Location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing in Boston. Hotel is very well kept up and in excellent condtion. Extras for our kids were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location, pool is a fantasic bonus, would return.”
Reviews.Author: crazyroadtrippers
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a wonderful location. The fitness centre & swimming pool are great. The rooms are really nice but not amazing & the bathroom very ordinary. Room service is just ridiculously expensive. The staff & concierge were charming & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: remifentanil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at FS Boston for 7 days for vacation. Not impressed. Room was spacious but extremely dark with only one small window overlooking back of the hotel. Can't even open the curtains as the room was ridiculously overlooked by other bedrooms. No coffee maker in the room. Nearest Starbucks/cafe is two long blocks away (I will not pay $20 for coffee even when money is no object). Complimentary coffee by the reception till 8am but the coffee pot was empty when I went. Asked the lady at the reception politely for refill and received 'huff and puff' though I was bothering her. No apologies just attitudes. Bathroom - very small bathtub. No separate shower. Only provides three bath towels. So if you're a couple you'll be fighting over the last clean towel. Bottom line: Nothing special about this hotel. Just a room with ordinary bed, TV and bathroom. Unremarkable hotel staff. Stayed at Mandarin Oriental and Westin Copley in my previous stay at Boston. I would definitely choose Mandarin or Westin (for value) for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daytripp-r
Reviews.Content: We were there for a board meeting and a couple of extra days to enjoy the City of Boston. At check in we were upgraded to a Suite and offered a cold beverage, which was very nice on a day that the Temperature was 99 degrees. The Room was exceptionally large and the Bed was very comfortable. Lots of Closet space and drawers were plenty. There was a very nice sitting room attached to the bedroom, with a 42 inch flat screen TV and a nice sized work space. Turn down service takes place quite early in the evening, about 4:30 PM during each day our four day visit. The Maid service was excellent and prompt. One day we ordered room service and it was on time, hot and delicious. The Coffee was great and the Orange Juice was fresh squeezed. A very nice way to wake up. I had breakfast in the Grille another day and the service was wonderful and my Eggs Benedict dish was perfect. The only fault I could find with this Hotel is the lack of a coffee maker in the room. There is a coffee and latte/cappuccino service in the lobby early in the morning, but that meant I had to go to the lobby and bring my coffee back to the room to enjoy while reading the morning paper... only a slight pain. The location of the Hotel is perfect for a visitor to Boston. Within walking distance to most historic sites, including the Theatre District, Boston Common and Public Garden and right across the street. Shopping on Newbury Street is a 3 minute walk. Beacon Hill and some great restaurants are across the Common, about a 10 minute stroll. And, for those Baseball Fans, the Arlington Street Subway station is 3 minutes up Boylston, and for $2 you can get to Fenway in about 15 minutes and enjoy a sporting event in one of the few remaining sporting Shrines. We enjoyed a great trip to Boston and a great Hotel experience at the Four Seasons Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Bathrooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: usopenman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a park view room which was very nice. However the bathroom was small and in need of a renovation. Come on, a tub that also is a shower should not be at a Four Seasons. These days it should be a standard that Four Seasons bathrooms should have a separate tub and shower. Besides that, the hotel itself is nice, not spectacular. They do have a very nice gym with all the most updated equipment such as weight machines, elliptical and treadmills with iPod access, etc. The location is perfect because it's right next to Boston Garden and also near all the great historical sights. The staff was great. The concierge was very helpful, and room service was delicious andcalways on time. Besides the need for an extensive renovation of the bathrooms, I would still go back and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: marksalie
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel.great location good service. Fair price

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location. One of the nicest suites ever.”
Reviews.Author: agpklp
Reviews.Content: For a city like Boston this room was almost too big for 1 person, but who's complaining. I guess the regular rooms were booked so this upgrade was appreciated. The location is incredible - park views and everything you would expect from Four Seasons as far as service and details. This was a business trip but I would certainly use this hotel for a couples weekend or family getaway. You can pretty much walk to everything, great restaurants, shopping, historical sites, parks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ajw65
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed at this hotel at least ten times over the past five years. To my way of thinking it's the finest in the city. Staff / Service - World-class. Everyone I have ever encountered - waiters in the restaurant, bellmen, doormen, room service, attendants at the fitness center, concierges, front desk staff is friendly (even if you're not a repeat guest they'll call you by name in many cases) and supremely competent. Much of the staff has been here for many years. They seem proud to work at the hotel and that gets transmitted to guests. Business Center - Excellent. Conveniently located between the concierge desk and front desk. Open 24-7 with your key. Three computer stations with dividers for privacy. Large printer/copier/fax machine as well. Fitness Center - Awesome! Lots of equipment. An incredibly attentive staff offering towels, water, etc. Great indoor swimming pool. If you grab a chair and sit near the pool the view of the city is unbeatable. Cleanliness/Aesthetics - Hotel is immaculately clean. Several areas (like the lobby and the pool area) are, visually, incredibly nice. Restaurant - Bristol Lounge off the lobby is a really comfortable, serene spot for breakfast (lots of "power breakfasts" here, it seems) or lunch. It's really nice without being really formal. Great views across Boylston Street of the public garden if you've got a window table. Unfortunately, "Aujourd Hui", the four-star restaurant on the second floor that closed several years ago. Sunday brunch there was amazing. It's always nice when a world-class hotel has, as many (including Four Seasons in D.C., Philadelphia, and New York) do, both a formal, "occasion", restaurant and a more casual one too. I miss that. Location - Fantastic! Directly across the street from the city's central "green spaces", the Public Garden and the Boston Common. Very easy access to "T" stops at Boylston or Arlington. Only a few minutes walk or ride to many of the most popular parts of town (Newbury Street, Copley, the Financial District, Quincy Market). Rooms - Large, spotlessly clean, lots of bathroom amenities. Suites are especially impressive. "Garden-view" rooms or suites provide a wonderful view, in any season, of the Public Garden, the Common, and the golden dome of the State House behind them. Cost - As a Four Seasons, it's the most expensive hotel in the city and doesn't present itself as anything else. If the cost is a deterrent that's understandable -- there are plenty of less expensive alternatives not far away. If the cost is manageable then a guest should feel like he or she is getting their money's worth. For all the reasons mentioned above I always...emphatically...do.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful! The perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kwatra
Reviews.Content: Superb staff. Very kid friendly. Fresh towels were always in the room along with the ice bucket being filled. Across the street from the Boston Commons which is nice to stroll along in the shade or take a Swan Boat ride. The indoor pool is refreshing for adults and yet not too deep for children. The hot tub was very relaxing, cold towels were offered for your head along with fresh fruit kabobs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: DBDCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located directly in front of a beautiful garden and across from the Boston Common. Walk through the park to Charles Street where you'll find a variety of restaurants, shops and pubs. While the room furnishings could use updating, the hotel is spotless and its staff are impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Once again the Four Seasons proves why it's a luxury hotel...”
Reviews.Author: flashpacker4822
Reviews.Content: Every Four Seasons I stay have stayed at have been great properties with a wonderful staff & the FS Boston was no exception. This was the first time at any FS property that I was offered use of their guest car & that was really convenient. Also, the FS had green apples in the hall which made me smile because I'm not a fan of red!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: soupfamily
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and service that exceeds all expectations. We will never stay anywhere else when visiting Boston. Thank you for making our anniversary the perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A 10--from check in, location, restaurant and room service, and kids loved the indoor pool.”
Reviews.Author: DavidMarino
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at Four Seasons as a couple in our mid-40's, and sometimes stay with our kids on family trips. This was our first time at the Boston location, and Four Seasons nailed it on every level.

Reviews.Title: “Serious luxury”
Reviews.Author: bklynchgo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Four Seasons in both Boston and Philadelphia and I've never been disappointed. Every staff member is extremely friendly (a minor miracle in Boston) and very helpful. The rooms are very well maintained. While they do charge for internet access, I love the free overnight shoe shine. My only regret is that, since I was here on business, I really didn't have the opportunity to enjoy all there is about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecco305
Reviews.Content: This is a must if your thinking of staying in boston. Yes, it is expensive but I cant stress enough how first class everything is done there and as the saying goes "you get what you pay for". My favorite spot in Beantown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel that I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: AndyS1414
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to stay at several fine hotels around the world. They all pale in comparison to the Four Seasons in Boston. The staff, the guest rooms, the concierge, the spa, the restaurant, even the doorman are all designed to provide the guest with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Excellence in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Colocav
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a Four Seasons you have the expectation that everything be a "cut above". The Four Seasons Boston does not disappoint. Outstanding service in a medium size property in the heart of Boston. Excellent access to all that Boston has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: PhilSommelier
Reviews.Content: You can never be disapointed with Four Seasons, and F.S. Boston is no exception. Great location, great service, beautiful spacious rooms, great food, all the amenities and comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for NY 4S Style Hotel? Go to the Mandarin!”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyageFamily
Reviews.Content: We love going to 4S in general, its a great brand. But this Boston one should simply not carry the 4S brand. As regular 4S travellers, we expect 4S quality and this hotel does not deliver the 4S experience and quality we expect and for which we pay for. Compared to New York and Istanbul for example, the hotel suffers from very old and low quality hotel building. Shower curtains is what we get at Hampton Inn on the highway, not at 4S. The breakfast area is packed with outsiders and the food quality is also not 4S caliber. It deserves to be redone 100%. Bangkok 4S is old and suffers a bit of the same drawbacks. But the service is so exceptional you almost forget the building issues. One positive note: the concierge "David" is top notch and the staff outside are very friendly and helpful. But nevertheless I would not return until its been renovated and I would tell anyone looking for the NY 4S style experience to simply book at the Mandarin which we also tried and loved.

Reviews.Title: “(Almost) lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: ouaems
Reviews.Content: Good: comfortable and very well located hotel. I stayed on business, but it would have been equally good if i'd been here on holiday. Great service from polite and efficient reception, restaurant and housekeeping staff. Not so good: the guest rooms are a little tired; for a 5 star hotel i was surprised, particularly the bathroom, where i would have expected at least a separate shower. Bar was not up to the same high standard as the rest of the hotel, I had lunch there before leaving and found the host unwelcoming and service very slow. Pity, because, otherwise I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: NEWLYRETIRED100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in Boston for 3 nights - everything was absolutely deluxe first class for our entire stay. The room was beautiful, bright, spotlessly clean, peaceful and quiet - the staff was superlative in every way. I was sick during our stay with a bad cold, and had to stay in for most of the time -- everyone was so accommodating -- they even comped a room service order of hot tea with honey. The only critique would be in the lobby and elevator landing decoration -- seemed a bit sparse and cold - unlike the old world warmth that normally characterizes a Four Seasons --but the room made up for it. Could not have asked for more from this hotel -- a 5 star experience, without question.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fantastic! We checked in with bad moods after the Ritz Carlton rejected our confirmation and was unable to accommodate us. Luckily, the Four Seasons came to our rescue! We pulled in and literally the second the cab stopped, we were greeted by a staff! Each door was opened and our luggage was removed quickly and sent up to the room. All the doormen were smiling and knew our names! Maybe our Amex agent tipped them off, but I still have no idea how everyone at check in and the doormen knew who we were! Check in was a breeze and we were upgraded to this gorgeous room with a view of the park. All the staff were excellent for the cordial men and women serving breakfast, to the room service, to the concierge. Sabrina was great! No corners were cut here. My son got a teenage welcome gift with root beer, candy, and pretzels. Turndown service and housekeeping was excellent! A kind gentleman accidentally dropped a glass while picking up our room service table and within 10 minutes, a whole cleaning staff was in our room cleaning everything! This hotel was just great and everyone should spend the extra $20 over the Ritz and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional city hotel with an excellent location and top-of-the-line amenities”
Reviews.Author: soberoi100
Reviews.Content: the Four Seasons boston is a top-notch hotel, with an outstanding location, just opposite the Boston Commons. It is within walking distance of Beacon Hill, with its lovely town-homes and great restaurants. There are a lot of high-end shops in the area and a good-sized shopping mall about 15 minutes walk away. The concierge at teh hotel was extremely helpful in setting up a car service, sightseeing, restaurant reservations, etc. Overall, the staff was polite and helpful, and room service breakfast arrived hot, with a thermos full of hot water for the tea. Overall, a very pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really a gem”
Reviews.Author: Millzo
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons properties can be tough because expectations are always so high. My husband and I loved this hotel. The room was lovely, view wonderful, and staff - so gracious. People in Boston are just the nicest anyway, right? Ok, at least I find that. Next time I'm in Boston, hopefully you'll find me here.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent and fabulous Four Seasons Boston..”
Reviews.Author: dzul
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at Four Seasons Boston and it was fabulous. The Executive City View room was great and I love its layout. The ambience is fantastic. Everything seems so perfect from the front office to housekeeping. The Bristol Lounge at the lobby floor is cool and I'd recommend its Lobster Roll Sandwich for lunch. The gym and indoor swimming pool are added value especially during winter. Laundry service is great too. Housekeeping make up the room twice a day and replenish the amenities regularly. We organized a dinner at its Ballroom and it went well. The service and food are extraordinary. I'd like to congratulate Philip Deschamps, the Assistant Director of Catering and his team for the great efforts. To Niamh Hartel, Sales Manager as well, who did a wonderful job and accommodate all our requests. To Alice (Bristol Lounge), stay beautiful and thank you Chase (Bellman) for your great job. Would definitely recommend this property and can't wait to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful. Want to live here.”
Reviews.Author: littlemissdelight
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about my recent weekend stay. The hotel is beautiful, the facilities are great. The food is delicious. The staff is attentive. I can't praise it enough. The rooms were beautiful, clean and very comfortable. The pool / whirlpool area was very nice and relaxing. I had a massage with Guy - also great. We had snacks and drinks there a couple of times throughout the weekend and everything was spot on. The menu in the Bristol Lounge is a nice mix of classics and new takes on classics. The crab cake sliders were amazing and the little mozzarella tater tots were just really tasty. I loved the cocktail list. I loved the little tea desserts the waitress was kind enough to bring out to me with our winter cocktails. I know I am gushing but I was just thrilled with this place from A-Z. I want to make this my go-to place when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “I always refer my friends and C.E.O.s to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld100
Reviews.Content: Partake in everything the hotel has to offer. If youre looking for cheap keep looking. This hotel is for Bentley shoppers not Yugo shoppers. If you need something while staying at this hotel just ask. Really if you need anything just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Service is what distinguishes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: It's the service that differentiates Four Seasons & this one is no exception. Very welcoming at check-in and all subsequent staff reinforce service is top priority. Of course, pay higher cost for Four Seasons than other hotels in the area. Great location in the Back Bay, comfortable rooms. I personally like the bottled water at turn down (rather than chocolate).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RASG
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic. Concierge was very helpful in finding restaurants. Location is perfect. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Deb1764
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel and it's location near the common is great for tourists. There's high end shopping close to the hotel and a shirt walk to many other shops. Subway is also close by. However I have to say we thought the hotel was probably more suited to business customers and a bit stuffy. Past experience would tell me that the club atmosphere of the ritz Carlton would have been more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: There is not a lot to say about this hotel except that it shows how good American hotels can be. Staff were very welcoming, rooms big and beautifully decorated (mine had a nice view over a park), bathroom excellent, breakfast just about perfect and the gym and pool were brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Best treatment ever!”
Reviews.Author: Beth0313
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel far exceeded any other hotel weâ€™ve stayed at. They made us feel welcome from the minute we drove up to the minute we left. When we arrived at the front desk the kids were greeted with a wagon of stuffed animals to pick from (kids ages were 1 and 3). The milk and cookies in the evening was also a very nice touch and a big hit the kids. All of the staff was very nice and accommodating. The food and service at the restaurant was also great. We had the kids with us and they were able to put us in a corner that was private so the kids could be kids. If we ever come to Boston weâ€™ll certainly be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Do not go there and do not trust what you see on their website. We had booked an executive suite and requested an additional bed to be put in the room, the first room we were given won't have enough room for the third bed and they call it suite! Floor plan for city view suite is the one for the garden view suites! Had a long discussion with general manager who promised things will be changed to avoid misunderstaning and as of today still misleading information. Also city view means view on the opposite building. General manager also offered and promised (nit requested by me!) a reimbursement in July following our conversation, I'm still waiting! Do not promise what you cannot keep.

Reviews.Title: “Boston with a view”
Reviews.Author: wsofrin
Reviews.Content: The four Seasons was very nice to stay at. I enjoyed the location, however felt I was in to large of a hotel. It always seems empty, and for some that is great. I prefer a hotel to be more cozy. The staff was amazing, but I think I would have done better if i had stayed a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but imperfect”
Reviews.Author: BusterCT1K
Reviews.Content: The room was very quiet - too quiet! Even the airconditioner was so quiet that the silence bothered me (I like my a/c to be giving off at least a little bit of sound. My room overlooked the Common and a major street but did not have any traffic noise at all. The rooms are very nice in the four seasons style that is to be expected. The service is genteel and polite. Unfortunately the TV was not working when I arrived and a repairman had to come fix it. The bed also had too many creases in the sheets to provide a perfect sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great indoor pool”
Reviews.Author: Beckett
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night and we were pleased with it. It is located right in front of the Boston Common and close to the Newbury Street shops and all the other city attractions. We were able to walk to restaurants, and didn't have a chance to eat the hotel. Per the other reviews, I'm sure the food prices are expensive at Four Seasons, but so many other choices are available within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel amenity we enjoyed greatly was the indoor pool located at the top of the hotel. It looks down on the Common and it is a great place to relax at the end of the day. The room itself was adequate, and I thought the bathroom itself was quite large given the age of the hotel. It is definitely up to FS standards. It was only a short stay, but we were pleased with it and would stay at this hotel again next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wayyyyy over priced but the service is exceptional- for a price!”
Reviews.Author: taz927
Reviews.Content: My wife and I tried to book the Langham Hotel in downtown Boston but they switched the rooms ( a double bed instead of a king) so I booked the four seasons instead looking forward to an exceptional hotel. Well it was way over priced. Every aspect of the hotel inflated its price- the valet was 50 plus tip, the breakfast was 78 and two desserts (room service) was fifty dollars! The room was just ok but cost 550.00 plus all the extra taxes and fees. So buyer beware there are better values out there with much better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: PalMarc
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons in Boston was disappointing. Lack of service and attention to detail made my stay an unpleasant experience. Rooms are little outdated and not my cup of tea. Location was perfect, but not sure if I will be staying here again. Unfortunately as I am a huge Four Season's fan!

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: abuscaglia
Reviews.Content: Traveled with kids, 3 nights in city. Great location. excellent service and friendly staff as usual from four seasons. 3rd night free but room was small for price.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime perfection: Service, Location, Luxury...”
Reviews.Author: aLITTLESpoiled
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the picturesque Boston Public Gardens, the Four Seasons brings truly seamless comfort to your time with them. After two nights there, we moved to to the Boston Harbor Hotel which absolutely cannot compare despite it's lovely harbor views. The Four Seasons is perfectly located for garden strolls, the Freedom Trail walk, shopping, et. al, and the staff, from Sam at the front desk to Marie, (Marianne.) our concierge were exceptionally gracious. Our room was spacious and quiet. We cannot say enough, and we cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBenp
Reviews.Content: The FS Boston is a great hotel. All the staff were friendly and polite, espcialy Walter the concierge. The food at the hotel was very good, breakfast would cost two people around $50. Our rooms were overlooking the park and were clean, had plenty of space, and a very comftable bed. the location of the hotel is it best point though, you wont need a car to get around as 90% of our eating and tours could be reached by foot, although if you dont want to walk there is a free car service the hotel provides aslong as its within 2.5 miles. The pool and spa were both excellent, espcialy the view on a sunny day from the pool. Over all i would stay again and recomend to anyone who wants a first class holiday

Reviews.Title: “Jumping the Shark”
Reviews.Author: vanderluyden
Reviews.Content: Jumping the shark My stay at the FS in Boston was a great letdown. Letâ€™s talk about the good features it still retains: a very good concierge service and tideness of rooms and common areas. But: when I checked in I was given a room right in front of the AC vent which, apart from being really noisy it cooled the room too much and it made entering the room a bit of a challenge as, servicing the whole seventh floor, it blasted out freezing air right on your back.
