I went right to the reception complaining about it and a young gentleman at the reception told me â€˜nobody has ever complained about it if it still bothers you tomorrow morning weâ€™ll turn the AC downâ€™. Well, one of the reasons I really like this hotel chain is that everything is always perfect and they take care of problems asap. I hate having to complain, move around once Iâ€™m settled down so I never went back. Breakfast the following morning was a challenge. I asked for a continental breakfast plus yougurt and eggs but I got the bill instead of the eggs. Strange I though letâ€™s see tomorrow morning! The day after I chose the American breakfast, same story: after a 45 minute wait I still hadnâ€™t got my eggs so I just paid and left. On the third day they finally managed to deliver the right order in a decent time. I also had lunch once day and it was decent but not the excellent quality I was used to at the FS. Besides you eat on plastic table mats which is really a let down for a high end hotel. What a difference from the FS in Paris where they iron the table clothes before setting the table! I remember they had them also the other time I was there but being service and food excellent you donâ€™t really mind. This time though it bothered me a lot, maybe because I spent a lot of time staring at them waiting for my breakfast. I had to be back for another two days but I cancelled ny reservation and decided for the Fairmont instead. While I was there the hotel was celebrating its 25th birthday: an old dame living on fame and memories!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the FS Boston for three evenings. Simply put, the hotel lived up to my expectations for a Four Seasons. The service and staff were excellent, the rooms were nice with the typical amenities and the facilities were excellent. The fitness room and pool were excellent. The location, across from the park, was superb. And what a wonderful park it is. Just beautiful. We did not dine in the restaurants or use room service so we have no view on the food. I cannot say anything negative about the hotel - we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jo&bod
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in quite a few FS hotels around the world and found FS Boston to be the most friendly and professional of them all the staff were surperb and everybody had time to chat and give you advice even though they were very busy. i would advise anybody to stay there even though it is pricey you get what you pay for excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good service, good location but eat elsewhere..........”
Reviews.Author: Spissen
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very good for lodging; we stayed 8 nights and liked their service, the large deluxe rooms, the ideal location, valet parking, beautiful flower arrangements in the lobby, pool etc. However, I donâ€™t recommend it for eating. Price-value relationship is poor. Food quality and service is very average. And at the Bristol dining room the service is off-handed and slow. Mineral water from Europe costs $ 30 for one Evian and one San Pellegrino; they smell Europeans to recommend the water â€“ itâ€™s a sure sellâ€¦once!! A breakfast for two in the room was billed $ 90 incl. service, we waited almost an hour and they had it all wrong. After complaining the price was reduced to $ 50. After these two experiences we preferred some of the excellent Restaurants in the neighbourhood were price and quality was good. Wifi is available at about $9 per day

Reviews.Title: “keep going back”
Reviews.Author: yatsey
Reviews.Content: when you think of all the things you look for in a hotel (location, service, room size) this place has it all. i must have stayed here a handful of times now over the last two years and the fact i keep gonig back says a lot. looks and feels modern in the public spaces and the rooms. doesnt need a long review, this place is close to perfect unless you like the smaller, boutique style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Having stayed here many times I finally am getting around to writing a review!”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: I sat at the computer for about five minutes after deciding to write a review of the Boston Four Seasons (having stayed here with my family at least six times). "Really", I thought "How does one write a review of a hotel that is part of the best luxury chain on Earth (Sorry Mandarin Orient!)?" But here I go... We live 20 miles outside of Boston and on special occasions (the most recent being my birthday) we will book a night or two at the Four Seasons. That should tell you something there. First- there are probably properties that are nice and perhaps a little nicer (The Taj, or the Millenium?) but none have the staff that the Four Seasons has. I actually purchased the new book that has been written by the founder of the Four Seasons to figure out just how they do it. Everyone is a pro- and everyone knows who you are , where you are from, that we had our twins with us. Knowing that our twins (who are eleven and well behaved) the staff allowed them to use the workout room (they had made the same exception last year when they were ten). The spa is super, the health club, just what one would expect (see how hard it is to write a review?) from a Four Seasons. The pool is on the 8th floor (perhaps the 7th?) with floor length windows opening up views of the Public Gardens. Day or night the views are incredible! The location at the Public Garden means you are just a half a mile from Newbury Street and Charles Street shopping. Unfortunately the last "Formal" Hotel Dining Room in Boston the Aujord Hui closed about 18 months ago- which is sad. But the informal formality of the Bristol Lounge with it's fire places, sofas, tables, and live jazz combo on Saturday Night are great fun. With Window opening up on the Gardens it is also fun to have breakfast. The only downside that we could see is that the furniture in our Suite (the chairs and Ottoman/Sofa) are just this side of being worn out. Given the prices that the Four Season's commands I would not expect this. Well I guess no one is perfect- although the Four Season's Boston comes close!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: JamieKate
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything negative to say about this place - it was excellent from start to finish. Very helpful staff without being intrusive, huge rooms, elegantly decorated, super clean, great gym and pool, delicious food on room service menu etc. The location was excellent for exploring Boston as well as vicinity to the business district. I loved everything about it and will definitely stay there next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelSevenB
Reviews.Content: Compared to the other Four Seasons I have stayed at it was terribly disappointing. Staff loitered at entrance, had to say excuse me to get through themâ€¦ what a greeting. Couldnâ€™t get rid of bellhop at the room, obviously trying to pad tip. Front desk unaccommodating, messed up parking. Will try the Ritz next time or plan on better stay at Marriott for half the price. Not the Four Seasons I once new and loved...

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: Pmggo
Reviews.Content: just one little story which shows how good this hotel is - whe housekeeping was in my room cleaning, they placed a book marker in my novel and unturned the page.Simple but great service. Maggie the concierge is brilliant and they drove us to our restaurant in the hotel town car (a brand new S class) for no charge (apart from our tip!)

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJim2009
Reviews.Content: This was about my 10th stay at FS Boston. The most amazing thing is the consistency of the serive and their staff. Everyone is freindly and understated except the Concierge can be a little pretentious. Rooms are the best and very very comfortable. The restaurant's food is excellent for any meal. I would recommend staying the side facing Boston Commons, it is quiter than the back side of the hotel. It is clean and neat and orderly throughout. Housekeeping and Room Service are spot on and there is always Management around to check on anything that is an issue. The location cannot be beat in Boston. No reason to go anywhere else, even for the price, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Places to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: VacaRae
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel- typical Four Seasons. Beautiful rooms, excellent service and best location in Boston- in the heart of luxury shopping without all of the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “For all Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Davunger
Reviews.Content: Over a three day period, every staff person who I encountered was friendly and accomodating--clerks, concierge, spa staff, doormen, housekeepers. Free NY Times and shoe shines, free car service within a mile of the centrally located hotel on the edge of the Boston Commons. I would say this is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “I want to move in..............”
Reviews.Author: JandLgoaway
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were advised that our room was upgraded to a Garden View ( most hotels you face the parking lot ) we had the most magnificent views of Boston Commons and the Boston Public Garden. The Staff was helpfull the rooms were very spacious. .........Highly recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super clean but the most uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for two nights for a wedding. The location is excellent, a quick ride from Logan Airport and right on the Boston Common. Its an easy walk to the shopping areas, Beacon Hill, etc. Plus they have a car that will drop you off most any place in Boston. The hotel itself is super clean. Everything is immaculately maintained and cleaned. There were constantly employees sweeping, cleaning, dusting, etc. We stayed in a basic room. The room was very spacious with a large marble bathroom. The toiletries were excellent and the furniture and carpeting, etc. was all clean and maintained. Housekeeping kept the room very clean and were very accommodating with requests. Only real complaint is that the beds are extremely uncomfortable. In the age of hotel chains marketing their signature beds, this was easily the most uncomfortable bed we have stayed in in a long time - and will keep up from staying at the Four Seasons in the future. It was lumpy, springy and hot. Other friends staying at the hotel also had similar comments. Other than the bed, we were very happy with the hotel. Only other complaint is that internet should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Avidhiker
Reviews.Content: We just had an overnight here and the best part was the staff. They are extremely helpful and friendly. They are what makes staying here pleasant. Having said that I doubt we would stay here again. First, given the cost of the rooms, being nickel and dimed with charges like $8 per day for wifi is really annoying. Secondly, realizing the people in the exercise room had a great view of me lying on my bed watching the tv was quite annoying. Lastly, being charged $28 for a pretty average diner breakfast was also a bit steep. Again the staff was great but I think there are several hotels in Boston that offer more than the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Great property with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: This property is all that you would expect of a Four Seasons and is in an excellent location. The interior design was more modern than I had expected and the views of the park are lovely. The staff at the property are very welcoming, friendly and attentive. This property does a great job of being professional without being stuffy. Staff also did a good job of anticipating needs and being proactive. Highly recommended. Much better than the Taj around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: austinhastings
Reviews.Content: Had the fortune of finding a good deal on a room at the Boston Four Seasons for a business trip. My experience at this hotel was, by far, the best I've yet to have. It's hard to imagine a more friendly, accommodating and able staff to help make for a more comfortable business trip. In addition to the stellar experience with the staff, the hotel was of high quality and it's hard to beat its location right across the street from Boston Common and right down the street from downtown. Would return again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Is there anywhere better to stay in Boston like this style of Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: NickNockLondon
Reviews.Content: We do a three day event at the Four Seasons every year for work and there is nowhere better in Boston to do this. The service, food and decor is exactly what you would hope for from the Four Seasons. Perfect location for shopping, the park and the buisness district. Great busy concierge

Reviews.Title: “Luxury plus the Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: jbroses
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Four Seasons in Boston to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. From the moment I checked in, they knew everything about us (my wife's nut allergy, the fact that it was our anniversary), and they did everything to make us feel like royalty. I had brought a bottle of champagne and called down to ask for a bucket of ice to chill it. They came up 10 minutes later with the bucket and ice... PLUS another obttle of complimentary champagne, already chilled, plus nut-free cookies and candies (with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate on the plate). They upgraded us to a deluxe room with a view, as well. It was just an incredible weekend. If you have a special occassion, this has GOT to be the place to celebrate it. The only reason I give it a 4 for value is because it is quite expensive. However, you absolutely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A really top rate Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel as you would expect of the brand in such mainstream city. I got upgraded to a big which actually was too big for my short stay ! I suppose that if you can only complain about the suite being too big, you have not had too bad a stay. Excellent and everything you would expect of it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect days in Four Season Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcelSB
Reviews.Content: I could recommend this hotel because is situated in center of the city, near the park, so you could walk to reach shops, Charles river, theaters and so on. Service and rooms are absolutely OK.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: MustTravel48
Reviews.Content: If you think luxury means aloofness, formality and exclusiveness, think again. The Four Seasons Boston is the perfect mix of warmth, graciousness, staff assistance and pampering. The concierge desk is friendly, upbeat and eager to make your stay special and easy. Five stars all the way--location, property, amenities and, most importantly, staff. Don't even think of staying at any other luxury establishment in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rjoc
Reviews.Content: I spent a wonderful 4 nights in the Four Season Hotel Boston with my wife at the beginning of June. The hotel is perfectly located at Boston Common, only a short walk from either tha Back Bay or Financial Districts. The is also a metro station about 150 metres away on Arlington Road. Check in was a straight forward enough affair with young lady explaining everything we needed to know about the hotel. She even gave us a sample breakfast menu and walked us to the elevator. We went to our room which was a garden view room overlooking the park across the street. The room was quite large with a huge, comfortable bed, a writing desk and a massive tv! The bathroom had a shower/bath and again was a decent size. Bathrobe, slippers and designer toiletries were standard. The only thing missing from the room was a hotel directory or perhaps I didn't look hard enough! As it was my wifes 40th birthday, there was a cake and some chocolate covered strawberries waiting in the room when we arrived and what woman dosen't like chocolate and strawberries? A nice surprise. Breakfast is served by a host of waiters/waitresses (except on Sundays when a brunch is offered) who will tend to your every need. I went for a bed and breakfast option which turned out to be a great move. An average breakfast for two waould cost in the region of $50. A short walk down the street will get you a massive breakfast for less than $10 for two people. While it was lovely in the hotel, it all seemed a bit formal. On the 8th floor is a gym and swimming pool. The gym has a good selection of machines and the treadmills have tv screens with complimentary headphones. The swimming pool offers a great view across Boston Common and there is a hot tube that would easily seat 15 people. In the locker/changing rooms there is a sauna and steam room. A full range of toiletries are available for use and razors are providied free of charge. Plenty of fluffy towels and robes are provided and the chilled face cloths are especially nice. Behind the Concierge desk there is a computer room where guests have free access to the internet by using their room key. There was a total of five computers and a printer/copier which was useful as we could check in for our flights and print our boarding cards. On the day of departure, we had a late flight home and our luggage was stored for us by the Concierge. The spa facilities were made available to us (at no extra charge) to shower and change before leaving for the airport. The best thing about this hotel for me was the staff. Everyone addressed you by name and certainly the staff members I encountered were genuinely nice. Perhaps it's down to how I approached them but they seemed to be more relaxed and at ease with me when compared with other guests. The doormen were an especially good laugh and gave me some great information about what was available off the beaten track in Boston. In the Four Seasons, you can see where your extra money goes because the level of service is exceptional and everything in the hotel worked exactly as it should have. On the last day I noticed a bulb gone in the lift and was almost relieved to find it! Make no mistake, it is expensive when compared to other five star hotels but having said that, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service & amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Moops
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for three nights to attend a wedding held at the hotel. Overall it was very comfortable, with an excellent location, and great service as expected from a Four Seasons hotel. I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return! Highlights: â€¢ Location â€“ Amazing location facing the Public Garden and Boston Common, easy walking distance to the Back Bay and the Freedom Trail â€¢ Clean, comfortable rooms â€“ Our 3rd-floor city-view room with King bed was quiet and spacious, with a large desk, small sitting area (armchair), and plenty of storage in the closet and dresser â€¢ Great service â€“ Everyone was extremely friendly, from the front of house, to room service, to cleaning staff; I was warmly greeted everywhere I went â€¢ Nice amenities â€“ Our room was equipped with a DVD player, safe, large umbrella, hair dryer, makeup mirror in the bathroom, Lâ€™Occitane toiletries, robes & slippers â€¢ Thoughtful small touches â€“ A newspaper of choice delivered to the room daily, free internet and printing at the business centre, complimentary green apples (handy as an afternoon snack!); with turndown service I even had a bookmark placed in my book! The only minor complaint was that we did not receive turndown one of the nights. I also heard from guests in our party (consistent with other reviews) that the pool was somewhat overrun with kids. All in all a very enjoyable stay! The wedding rate provided was US $400 a night so definitely a splurge -- if you reserve directly through the Four Seasons website, I believe there are often multiple-night stay packages that provide better value.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldie_Mack
Reviews.Content: We live outside Boston and often visit the Four Seasons for drinks, dining, or afternoon tea. We'd never actually stayed at the hotel, so when my wife's birthday rolled around in March, we decided to stay for a quick weekend getaway. Our stay exceeded our high expectations. I contacted David, the concierge, earlier in the week before our stay to arrange for a floral arrangement, a birthday snack and dinner advice. He came through wonderfully on all fronts and reserved us a free ride to dinner in the house car, which is a Mercedes S class. The flowers and chocolate surprise delighted my wife and we both got a kick out of being driven around in the Benz! We spent the afternoon at the hotel pool/spa, which was great - very relaxing. The room was nicely decorated and felt rather large even though it was a standard room. I used the workout facilities, which were fairly spacious though nothing extraordinary. We had Sunday brunch in the Bristol, which is one of our favorite dining spots from an ambience perspective. They gave us a free slice of birthday cake after the meal, which was a nice touch. Overall, we really enjoyed the property. It was our first time staying at a city Four Seasons after staying at various FS resorts in AZ and HI. The service, location and overall experience were all terrific. It made for a really special b-day weekend for my wife. We look forward to staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spamstan
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of staying at the Four Seasons in Boston. It's first class all the way, as one might expect. Location is outstanding, right across the street from the Public Garden and the Common. Service was top notch. From the cold water they offer at the front door after a morning run to the front desk attendant hunting down a cup of coffee after I missed the morning freebie I was never disappointed. The room was comfortable and quiet. And large, with a nice work space and small sitting area. Really there is nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a ripoff, not up to usual four seasons standard”
Reviews.Author: Okie2
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a heavily discounted rate for our 4 night stay at the four seasons in boston, but even paying only $300 a night this place simply didn't represent value for money. It felt like an anonymous four star business hotel rather than a proper member of the four seasons brand, and we've stayed at much better 4 star business hotels in both boston and other US cities. good points: friendly, efficient concierge - helped out with lost contact lenses, local cinema listings, restaurants recommendations. hotel bar - great ambience and some excellent house cocktails, a fun place to kill a couple of hours (although obviously available to non-guests too) location - just in front of the beautiful boston gardens, a few minutes walk from most of the major sites and shopping areas bad points: rooms - first one we were given stank of stale cigarette smoke and had a dirty bathroom. We asked to move and second room was better, but still very small with an outdated bathroom. Both rooms certainly much smaller than the Hilton boston airport we stayed at. There was also nothing in the rooms that set them apart from any 4 star business hotel. pool and gym area - extremely disappointing, looks like a penthouse pool with city views in the photos, but turned out to be squalid with dirty floor and towels strewn everywhere, screaming kids treating it as a paddling pool (with staff looking on) and jacuzzi tub that was out of order and had been so for two months! staff at front entrance - these guys were more focused on tips than on providing a useful service. They would all get involved in the most minor task (eg, picking car up from valet), and we'd be left feeling uncomfortable because we felt pressured to tip all of them, even though it should only have taken one of them to help us each time. On the last day, one of them actually went as far as saying "make sure you thank my colleagues" when a total of 4 guys got involved in bringing our car round and putting one bag in it! housekeeping - room never got restocked with enough toiletries...felt like we were being rationed and even a note left clearly visible with the daily tip for the maid, asking for more, was ignored. The tip was taken though! There are several better hotels in the city to be had for a third the price, think Jury's, Marriott or Hilton. Factor in the $700 dollar rack rate and this hotel becomes a joke. Offers nothing for the extra money and does not deserve to be part of the four seasons family

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Expect_quality_2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night during a trip to Boston. Fantastic experience. Great location overlooking the Public Gardens and Boston Common. Very friendly greeting on arrival, although it was nearly over-the-top at times. We had left our bags in the hotel early in the morning while we spent the day skiing, and bags came to our room very promptly after arriving that evening. Room was very comfortable, king size bed and lots of room. Very large en-suite. Used the leisure centre after arriving that evening at about 7pm. However, there were about 7 young kids in the pool, unsupervised, and made it impossible to swim as they were jumping from lane to lane. Jacuzzi was nice and relaxing. Disappointed that it was not possible to use the steamroom or sauna with my wife, as these are located in their respective changing rooms. Used the pool again the following morning and it was a bit better. However, I feel that if kids are not behaving in a pool, they should be asked to leave, it ruins everyone else's enjoyment of it. We had dinner in the downstairs lounge that night. Lovely window table looking our over the Public Gardens. Service by Keith was very prompt and friendly, as well as being very professional. Wine that I had ordered ($45) was not available, so I received an alternative worth $65 and was charged $45, which was good service. Food was of a very good quality and very enjoyable. Overall, was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Possibly the Best Hotel in the World for Service”
Reviews.Author: Fiveoclockcaptain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my wife's birthday (one ending in a "0"). Each and every staff person wished her a happy birthday, there was a nice welcome presentation and just impeccable manners and service from the staff at every turn. It's hard to describe how much better the service is at this hotel over others. Each staff member "gets it", whether a bellman, housekeeper or maintenance worker - everyone knew how to properly read the situation and make the right move or say the right thing. Amazing. Some asian hotels have service of this caliber and also some of the high end cruise lines, but few hotels. Location, rooms, food service are all of the highest quality, but service is their strongest suit among perfection in all that they do.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: T_BoneTipperary
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i've ever stayed in. The service was top class. They let me check in early afternoon which was handy as I'd been strugling after a big night out! Rooms and bathrooms top class. Location was good. The bar next door was fantastic. Yes you're paying through the nose (I was tempted to stick in the bathrobe with my toiliteries on the way out but thought better of it!) but you get everything so if you can afford it or if it's a one off indulgence (the latter in my case unfortunately) then you won't get better anywhere else. Can't thing of any negatives. The highlight was when the doorman was lining up a Taxi for myself and a good buddy I grew up with to Logan airport he said "where you guys off to?"The answer as it turned out was "eh Las Vegas and NYC respectively" to which he responded "Ah Man I gotta hang out with you guys!". He got a decent tip!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons lives up to reputation”
Reviews.Author: jnb2375
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed that the Four Seasons actually lived up to its reputation. Staff and service were flawless. Little extras included with turndown service were a nice touch as well. Shoes were shined well and wrapped individually in tissue paper on return. Great fitness center and lap pool. I was not on the Commons side of the hotel, and I will warn that the view on the opposite side is of an office building and a parking garage. Also, I had a handicapped room. I hope this was a "mobility impaired" room and not a wheelchair accessible room, as there was still a tub, albeit with grab bars. Incidentally, the restaurant Finale in back of the hotel has an excellent dessert sampler!

Reviews.Title: “First Class!!”
Reviews.Author: BMR10023
Reviews.Content: They do everything right at the Four Seasons in Boston! The rooms are immaculate, the food is great, room service is quick and they'll take care of your every request, the service staff pays attention to every detail, you never have to wait for anything, the restauarants will cater to your every need and the location is perfect. My husband and I have stayed at this hotel approximately ten times and we've been well taken care of every time. And this says quite a bit, as we've stayed at at least 50 hotels together (usually ones that are known to be fabulous, including many of Boston's top hotels) and this hotel is second to none in Boston. And of all the hotels I've stayed in worldwide, this hotel is second only to the Four Seasons Hawaii (Big Island/Kona location).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is BEAUTIFUL and located in a spectacular spot in Boston. So nice - the rooms were gorgeous - just perfect. Great service - first class all the way!

Reviews.Title: “My Absolute Favorite”
Reviews.Author: 5starlady
Reviews.Content: I'm biased because I adore the city of Boston. This hotel does it right. Warm reception at front desk, knowledgeable concierge staff, comfortable but elegant rooms. Location could not be better

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MTZinzan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and four children for three nights in late October. Had a wonderful stay and especially enjoyed the gym and leisure centre. In particular, the staff were exceptionally friendly and courteous - the only exception being a young man in the Leisure centre who was a bit up himself - and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any of my friends fro any sort of getaway. As noted by other reviewers the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: cbuie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay in Boston. This property is a little worn and not as perfect as some of the other 4S properties-the chair in our room had stains on it, and the tv remote was dirty. However, those were the only 2 glitches. I agree that at the prices you pay for a 4S, 2 glitches is too many, but 4S is one of the few hotels that I know I can count on, and Boston was no exception. Our room and bath were very clean (other than the remote, obviously)- no stray hairs to be found on the linens, in the bed, or in the bath (one of my pet peeves!). The service was definitely up to 4S standards, and the location across from Boston Common was great. We were given a ride by the "house car" to dinner one night (a free service) and were given excellent recommendations by the concierge on where to eat and what to see. We had an excellent stay- the location was great, the service was excellent, and our room was spacious and very clean. This would definitely be my choice if ever in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't As Good As Expected”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: Out of all the Four Seasons we have seen and stayed in, this definitely was not one of the best. We were in a room directly overlooking the public gardens, which were lovely. The rooms are nicely decorated but on the small size. Our bed was quite hard. However, upon request, housekeeping did put an egg crate on the mattress and that really helped. In the small bathroom, a glass door only covered 2/3 of the shower leaving the last third open. Between that and the gape between the glass where it opened, we had a flooded floor every time we took a shower. On the plus side, check in was smooth, the hotel was clean and the location is outstanding (on Boylston Ave. near the best shopping and restaurants in Boston) and overall the service was good. The t.v.s were plasmas with a great picture, the towels were nice and soft. The Bristol lounge was a bit slow but the food was better than in room dining. The cocktails were also quite good and potent. There were two incidents that made my husband and I think that there is a little lack of communication with their staff. Each morning, we would receive a call that was meant for another room, waking us early, followed one morning by a maid delivering a pair of pants to us at 6:00 a.m., only to be told they have the wrong room. We grew tired of them waking us for reasons that were not ours. Also, when the turn down maid came to deliver fresh towels, she put them on the toilet seat before she attempted to hang them up. I told her we didn't want any new towels. By now, I thought there were some things that management should know, so I made a call down to them to make them aware of some of their staff issues. After I spoke to the manager on duty, she told me that she would comp most of our room stay to make up for what happened. We were very thankful that she handled the problem with so much generosity. If she hadn't, I could not in good conscience, have given this hotel even four stars. As it was though, she redeemed their hotel, especially by talking to each department that had made the mistakes. We received apologetic follow up calls from each department involved. We sincerely hope that this will help their service to improve here.

Reviews.Title: “Just Not Quite There on Service”
Reviews.Author: cheesi
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful. The greeting from front desk staff was great. Our room was beautiful - so why couldn't we give this an "Excellent"? Service in the Bristol Lounge is the answer. We spent two nights at the hotel. Both nights we had to wait on service, not only to get served, but for our check. Ordered a coffee/liquor and got exactly 1 cup of coffee - no offer for a refill or even checked on by the staff. Area was great, but I think next time we would try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: manone151
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular in both its features and its service. I absolutely loved everything about the hotel, from the elegant lobby area, to the comfortable and spacious guest rooms to the incredible dining room. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston. It is in a good location and close to alot of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Tenley
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. We were there for a wedding (which was lovely, great food and decor and service) and had a wonderful time. Our room was spacious and well outfitted. Service (one hour valet, shoeshine, newspapers, concierge making salon bookings) was great and check in and out was a breeze. Staff was very service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: eskew
Reviews.Content: Was in this hotel 2 nights, for a wedding (which was also taking place at the hotel). Property is well located, on the main shopping street just a few blocks away from Back Bay and south of the Common. Lobby and bar look good, corridors and rooms (at least the two that I saw) could do with some refurb, they look a little tired. Room (we had a standard) was not very large but spacious enough, furniture a little dated but functional, bathroom needs a little upgrading. The top floor gym/spa/pool is small but nice. Service meets the Four Seasons standard, but nothing to make us write home about. In all a pleasant experience, but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Typical Four Seasons. Amazing service, restaurants, rooms and location. Close to Newbury Street and the Public Garden we were only there for a night but it was worth it! Had dinner and afternoon tea. We were upgraded from room to suite and had a marvelous time.

Reviews.Title: “Dull and charmless”
Reviews.Author: Trebor68
Reviews.Content: Reading the many reviews of this hotel I am inclined to believe that people are rating (or gushing over) this hotel on its reputation, or that of the Four Seasons chain, and not the hotel itself. In my view this must be the least comfortable and stylish Four Seasons I have stayed in with the smallest bedroom I have ever experienced in the group. The hotel lacks any style, is devoid of any character or personality, is furnished cheaply and struck me more as a nice Holiday Inn or Marriot property, with nothing exceptional about it you would expect from Four Seasons. Overall, service was OK, hotel was dull and charmless, location excellent, service fine but not exceptional. Four Seasons, either try much harder or hand this property over to a chain that would manage it at a rate more in line with the service and personality of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Imperfect Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: nycinvestmentbanker
Reviews.Content: I only stay at Four Season properties so I have a good base of knowledge about them. Unfortunately, this one is the worst. Where to start? -lengthy check-in process -construction in the lobby -so many classes of rooms that it is hard to get an upgrade that is worthwhile. -doorman actually asked me if i was a guest at the hotel and i had to prove it before he called me a cab -housekeeping walked in on me even though i had a DND sign on the door -the room service was cold -the bed I had was not the typical four seasons bed. Seriously not a Four Seasons property at its finest. For that - try London or New York.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons, Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: The_Deacons
Reviews.Content: Have you ever been to a bad four seasons hotel? I didn't think so - me neither. This hotel offers everything we have come to know and love about the four seasons. Impeccable service, great rooms, good pool, brunch is amazing. The best hotel in Boston. I always stay there when I am in town - but be warned, I left it too late last time and they had no room for me. My wife still hasn't forgiven me.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: szmc
Reviews.Content: Anytime you stay at the Four Seasons you are living in a fantasy world! Exquisite service, professional staff and wonderful rooms! Great for a splurge or a treat. Boston has so much to offer and the four season delivers first class style.

Reviews.Title: “The 4 in Fours Seasons is for Service”
Reviews.Author: onmyway
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is the best hotel in Boston. The roof top pool has one of the best views and the service can't be beat. The location is great for a quick walk through the Common , Newbury Street, Chales St, Beacon Hill and theatres. We have stayed at the Marriot Long Wharf, Marriot Copley, Westin, Sheraton , Air port Hilton, and the Ritz Carlton (now the Taj) the Four Seasons is definately the best. It also has the best children's menu and ammenities for kids. The work out room is great. The only thing missing are pedicure and manicure services at the hotel. There are very few hotels in Boston that have full spa services on site. The Westin claims to, but, the spa is actually in the Copley Mall. Not so condusive to walking down through the lobby in your robe. If you can stay at the Seasons when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the United States”
Reviews.Author: MusicFlyer
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to the Boston Four Seasons...with our 6 and 9 year olds. Let me tell you: if this is something you can afford or luxuriate to, please do so. It is a magnificent hotel. FIVE STARS. From the maid service to the wait staff to the car service (if you need to take a short trip), it's all here. First class all the way. The maid service, the amenities, the world-class pool over looking Boston Commons, the gym, the spa. My goodness! It's magical! Yes, it's expensive but it's worth every single penny. Period! This is one of my favorite hotels in the United States.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: SP103
Reviews.Content: This is a long review as it's a 5 star property, so when you stay at a place like this you expect everything perfect. We reserved the romance package for a Saturday evening. I was disappointed in the online booking process I was unable to select a smoking room. I called the room reservations after booking and they stated no problem. Valet was extremely quick (part of the package), then check-in was very friendly and speedy as well. The attendant did the standard four seasons walk around where they walk you to the elevators which I admit is a nice touch. When we arrived at the room, no ashtrays! I thought my fiancee was going to flip out. And then the weirdest thing happened. I said "I'll call them for an ashtray" and just as I finished speaking their was a knock at the door. It's an employee with 2 ashtrays. Knock, Knock Neo (Matrix anyone?) was all I could think of! The room itself was down to the bone clean, with a 42 inch Hi-Def TV. We did not have a view of the common back the back of Vadassha way. That didn't bother me as I was upgraded for free as I booked their cheapest room. The room I booked was $345 with the package and I got the $545 room. Interesting note, they only have 11 of the cheap rooms per their website, and 150 of the "deluxe" rooms. So it looks like everyone gets bumped up. For once, the Hi-Def TV did actually have some Hi-Def channels, but just the basic channels (4,5,7 Fox, etc). I'd expect a full HD cable lineup at the four seasons. Another disappointments with the room was no stereo and coffeemaker. The lack of a hotel guestbook was noticeable too when I attempted to get a ride in the complimentary limo service. I found that to be booked. So if you want to use that service on a weekend, call the concierge ahead of time to reserve it. The minibar was a little understocked in the snacks part, but the prices were not out of control ($5 for a beer, thats not too outrageous). We received champagne and treats with our romance package, we liked the champagne but hated the treats (hey, we admit not be foodies, we like chex mix so, if you are you'll probably love them!). The bathroom in the room was large and comfortable with nice toiletries. They didn't give you the whole gambit of stuff however like mouthwash etc. The shower was hot and powerful and the towels I thought were average. The robes they provide are nice. My fiancee liked the lighted make-up mirror. I hated it because I could see my poor shaving job from earlier in the day :) . We went out for dinner and drinks in downtown and came back and found our room refreshed with turn-down service. It was really nice with bottles of water, lights dimmed and everything re-cleaned. The next morning our breakfast was right on time (again, with our package deal). The food was good, someone mentioned earlier in that they limit you to eggs, bacon etc which is true. I couldn't imagine paying nearly $70 for this breakfast for two but when it's included it's good. Checkout was fast and I left the comment card at the concierge and my car was waiting for me when I came outside. I checked out the fitness and pool area quickly, and was offered a bathing suit and work-out clothes and a drink for just walking in the door. That was impressive. Every employee there was focused on making you feel special. The only other true 5 star hotel I have stayed at was Mohegan Sun, so comparing is difficult. I found Mohegan Sun to have a few extra room features that Four Seasons lacked. However, Mohegan does not have Hi-Speed wireless internet or flat-screen Hi-Def TVs as of yet. The service is not the issue at this Four Seasons, nor the location. It's the amount of technology and guest comfort within the room that is missing. I will give it a bit of a slide however seeing it's an older building. Our entire stay was stone silent in our hallway (well designed for this purpose). As far as price, I paid $380 with tax for the romance package. The regular rate was $295 (without tax). So with the package I got $40 valet parking, champagne and treats, and a $70 breakfast so the deal is very good. So is it the best in Boston? It depends. Maybe not for our age range (25-35) who enjoys a little more technology in the rooms like found at a Kimpton's Hotel Marlowe,Nine Zero or the XV Beacon. If you are dependent on the hotel for services aka packages, arranging dinner plans etc I would pick the Four Seasons as their staff is amazing. Again, it's location is perfect, a cab ride to Fanieul Hall was under $10. I would assume the same price to and from the Fenway park (kenmore) area. We had a great time, thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Boston - BUT”
Reviews.Author: Fontaine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in almost every good hotel in Boston - some multiple times - and this is without a doubt the best hotel in Boston based on location, amenities (beautiful swimming pool), newly renovated guest rooms and generally careful service. The reason that this hotel isnt higher rated among Boston hotels, in my opinion, is that at the prices this hotel charges there is no room for error. This weekend the hotel was generally lovely - with some problems. My friends' room was not made up until after 2:30 - and only because she called. This is unacceptable, especially considering they were out of the room since before 9. The Bristol lounge is being renovated and there was no other place for a cocktail at 11pm. Breakfast on Sunday was extremely crowded - we were told that without a reservation there were no tables, although we were not cautioned to make reservations despite being on the bed and breakfast special (a table was eventually found). The food was cold and the service was bad, just not enough help in a crowded room (there were many families having brunch who appeared not to be guests of the hotel). The hot tub had small children in it - with their pool toys. But despite all of this the renovated rooms are truly lovely and the location can't be beat. By the way - this is a dog friendly hotel - and I saw, surprisingly, some very large dogs.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Land 0' Libs”
Reviews.Author: Pramstroker
Reviews.Content: Well, I knew I wasn't in a red state any more when I saw John Kerry throwing one down in the hotel's bar. Political issues aside, this is a great hotel, great staff and it is our preferred place to stay in Boston. Well located for all the things there are to do in Boston. My kids loved the chocolate covered strawberry's at night. One caveat: parking is expensive at $38 per night. Not unusual for large city parking, but still alot.

Reviews.Title: “Great views over The Common.”
Reviews.Author: Livingoutofasuitcase
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons = Top quality. You know what you are getting whehn you book at one of these hotels. Upgraded to a suite which was massive; service was top notch & instantaneous (!) and wonderful views over Boston Common. Highly recommended! Note though that you are a few minutes drive to the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: DCroamer
Reviews.Content: Bostonâ€™s Four Seasons is a comfortable and elegant hotel in the heart of the city. My wife and I stayed in an Executive King Suite over the Thanksgiving holiday. The suite consisted of a bedroom and sitting room, both with spectacular views of the Boston Garden. The good news: the housekeeping was terrific. The bed was as comfortable as any Iâ€™ve slept in. Thought the room faced Boylston Street â€“ a busy thoroughfare â€“ there was practically no noise. The appointments, while not inspired, were certainly elegant. Flat screen TVâ€™s in both bedroom and sitting area. The gym and pool area were very nice. Great toiletries in the bathroom and good robes and slippers were provided. The staff was very professional and nice. The Concierge was most helpful in arranging a number of activities â€“ including a catered dinner. Also, the less formal restaurant â€“ the Bistro â€“ was very nice and the food was excellent. Always keep in mind, it is a Four Seasons, so everything costs. You practically have to have a stack of Five Dollar bills for tipping anyone and everyone associated with the hotel. That said, we had a very good stay and would stay again. The best part is that the hotel is in the heart of everything. It is on Boylston Street in walking distance from great shopping and strolling on Boylston, Newberry Street and Charles Street. There are a number of fantastic restaurants nearby as is Bostonâ€™s theater district. It is also situated just across from the Public Garden and the Boston Common. The location really couldnâ€™t be better. A couple of minor complaints. First, given the cost of the room, we were surprised by the lack of drawer space. There is no â€œdresserâ€� as such. There are scattered pieces of furniture with scattered drawers, but it seemed somewhat hap-hazard. Second, I like my hotel rooms cold and I could never get the temperature quite right. The thermostat said 65 degrees but I am quite sure it never got that cold. The windows would not open and we were told there was a repair issue. Ultimately, we had a fan brought in and that solved the problem. Also, the couch in the sitting room could have been more comfortable, but that is a personal preference. However, in the end, we were well satisfied by the hotel and impressed by the service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience, Articles stolen from Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: jonhyde6
Reviews.Content: After staying at the hotel for a wedding, my room was broken into and a significant amount of Jewelry stolen. The Boston Police Department has since found the thief and has a video of the gentlemen leaving my hotel room. Through this terrible ordeal the 4 Seasons has been unbelievable. They have claimed that it is not their responsibility and refuse to insure my belongings. On top of everything, I was shocked when they didn't even bother to comp my room after I had to deal with a police report all day. Do not stay here unless you want to deal with a rude and terrible staff at a 2-3 star hotel. Try the Taj

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location....”
Reviews.Author: field-guide
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for a business trip, and had a very nice experience: the service was really lovely -- both warm and competent, with attention to detail -- although at times a little overly solicitous. The rooms are nicely furnished, and the little additions to the children's rooms were thoughtful. Be aware, however, that the "city view" rooms have an unexceptional view of the theater district; the "garden view" of the Public Garden is far better (although the hotel only goes up to 8 floors, so some of the view will be obscured by the leaves of trees in the summer months.) The location on the Public Garden is just wonderful, right near the swan boats and Newbury Street -- it's really a great part of the city for exploring on foot. Overall, I found this hotel to be pleasant and very well managed -- but to me, the real reason to stay here is that you're right in the heart of the most charming part of Boston.
